trans-unit.source: Use time-based Hadoop Oozie coordinator in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use time-based Hadoop Oozie coordinator in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use time-based Hadoop Oozie coordinator in HDInsight, a big data service.
trans-unit.target: Use time-based Hadoop Oozie coordinator in HDInsight, a big data service.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to define Oozie workflows and coordinators, and submit jobs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to define Oozie workflows and coordinators, and submit jobs.

trans-unit.source: Use time-based Oozie coordinator with Hadoop in HDInsight to define workflows and coordinate jobs
trans-unit.target: Use time-based Oozie coordinator with Hadoop in HDInsight to define workflows and coordinate jobs

trans-unit.source: In this article, you'll learn how to define workflows and coordinators, and how to trigger the coordinator jobs, based on time.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you'll learn how to define workflows and coordinators, and how to trigger the coordinator jobs, based on time.

trans-unit.source: It is helpful to go through [Use Oozie with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-oozie] before you read this article.
trans-unit.target: It is helpful to go through [Use Oozie with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-oozie] before you read this article.

trans-unit.source: To learn Azure Data Factory, see [Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory](../data-factory/data-factory-data-transformation-activities.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn Azure Data Factory, see [Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory](../data-factory/data-factory-data-transformation-activities.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article requires a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article requires a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on using Oozie, including time-based jobs, on a Linux-based cluster, see [Use Oozie with Hadoop to define and run a workflow on Linux-based HDInsight](hdinsight-use-oozie-linux-mac.md)
trans-unit.target: For information on using Oozie, including time-based jobs, on a Linux-based cluster, see [Use Oozie with Hadoop to define and run a workflow on Linux-based HDInsight](hdinsight-use-oozie-linux-mac.md)

trans-unit.source: What is Oozie
trans-unit.target: What is Oozie

trans-unit.source: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, such as Java programs or shell scripts.
trans-unit.target: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, such as Java programs or shell scripts.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows the workflow you will implement:
trans-unit.target: The following image shows the workflow you will implement:

trans-unit.source: ![Workflow diagram][img-workflow-diagram]
trans-unit.target: ![Workflow diagram][img-workflow-diagram]

trans-unit.source: The workflow contains two actions:
trans-unit.target: The workflow contains two actions:

trans-unit.source: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to count the occurrences of each log-level type in a log4j log file.
trans-unit.target: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to count the occurrences of each log-level type in a log4j log file.

trans-unit.source: Each log4j log consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field to show the type and the severity, for example:
trans-unit.target: Each log4j log consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field to show the type and the severity, for example:

trans-unit.source: The Hive script output is similar to:
trans-unit.target: The Hive script output is similar to:

trans-unit.source: For more information about Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].
trans-unit.target: For more information about Hive, see [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive].

trans-unit.source: A Sqoop action exports the HiveQL action output to a table in an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: A Sqoop action exports the HiveQL action output to a table in an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Sqoop, see [Use Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop].
trans-unit.target: For more information about Sqoop, see [Use Sqoop with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-sqoop].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see [What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions].
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see [What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorials works on HDInsight cluster version 2.1 and 3.0.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorials works on HDInsight cluster version 2.1 and 3.0.

trans-unit.source: This article has not been tested on HDInsight emulator.
trans-unit.target: This article has not been tested on HDInsight emulator.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as an administrator and set the execution policy to *RemoteSigned*.
trans-unit.target: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as an administrator and set the execution policy to *RemoteSigned*.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Run Windows PowerShell scripts][powershell-script].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Run Windows PowerShell scripts][powershell-script].

trans-unit.source: **An HDInsight cluster**.
trans-unit.target: **An HDInsight cluster**.

trans-unit.source: For information about creating an HDInsight cluster, see [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision], or [Get started with HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started].
trans-unit.target: For information about creating an HDInsight cluster, see [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision], or [Get started with HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started].

trans-unit.source: You will need the following data to go through the tutorial:
trans-unit.target: You will need the following data to go through the tutorial:

trans-unit.source:
Cluster propertyWindows PowerShell variable nameValueDescription
HDInsight cluster name$clusterNameThe HDInsight cluster on which you will run this tutorial.
HDInsight cluster username$clusterUsernameThe HDInsight cluster user name.
trans-unit.target:
Cluster propertyWindows PowerShell variable nameValueDescription
HDInsight cluster name$clusterNameThe HDInsight cluster on which you will run this tutorial.
HDInsight cluster username$clusterUsernameThe HDInsight cluster user name.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight cluster user password $clusterPasswordThe HDInsight cluster user password. Azure storage account name$storageAccountNameAn Azure Storage account available to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight cluster user password $clusterPasswordThe HDInsight cluster user password. Azure storage account name$storageAccountNameAn Azure Storage account available to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, use the default storage account that you specified during the cluster provision process. Azure Blob container name$containerNameFor this example, use the Azure Blob storage container that is used for the default HDInsight cluster file system.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, use the default storage account that you specified during the cluster provision process. Azure Blob container name$containerNameFor this example, use the Azure Blob storage container that is used for the default HDInsight cluster file system.

trans-unit.source: By default, it has the same name as the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: By default, it has the same name as the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: **An Azure SQL database**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure SQL database**.

trans-unit.source: You must configure a firewall rule for the SQL Database server to allow access from your workstation.
trans-unit.target: You must configure a firewall rule for the SQL Database server to allow access from your workstation.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about creating an Azure SQL database and configuring the firewall, see [Get started using Azure SQL database][sqldatabase-get-started].
trans-unit.target: For instructions about creating an Azure SQL database and configuring the firewall, see [Get started using Azure SQL database][sqldatabase-get-started].

trans-unit.source: This article provides a Windows PowerShell script for creating the Azure SQL database table that you need for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This article provides a Windows PowerShell script for creating the Azure SQL database table that you need for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source:
SQL database propertyWindows PowerShell variable nameValueDescription
SQL database server name$sqlDatabaseServerThe SQL database server to which Sqoop will export data.
trans-unit.target:
SQL database propertyWindows PowerShell variable nameValueDescription
SQL database server name$sqlDatabaseServerThe SQL database server to which Sqoop will export data.

trans-unit.source: SQL database login name$sqlDatabaseLoginSQL Database login name. SQL database login password$sqlDatabaseLoginPasswordSQL Database login password. SQL database name$sqlDatabaseNameThe Azure SQL database to which Sqoop will export data.
trans-unit.target: SQL database login name$sqlDatabaseLoginSQL Database login name. SQL database login password$sqlDatabaseLoginPasswordSQL Database login password. SQL database name$sqlDatabaseNameThe Azure SQL database to which Sqoop will export data.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] By default an Azure SQL database allows connections from Azure Services, such as Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] By default an Azure SQL database allows connections from Azure Services, such as Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: If this firewall setting is disabled, you must enable it from the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: If this firewall setting is disabled, you must enable it from the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: For instruction about creating a SQL Database and configuring firewall rules, see [Create and Configure SQL Database][sqldatabase-create-configure].
trans-unit.target: For instruction about creating a SQL Database and configuring firewall rules, see [Create and Configure SQL Database][sqldatabase-create-configure].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Fill-in the values in the tables.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Fill-in the values in the tables.

trans-unit.source: It will be helpful for going through this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: It will be helpful for going through this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Define Oozie workflow and the related HiveQL script
trans-unit.target: Define Oozie workflow and the related HiveQL script

trans-unit.source: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (an XML process definition language).
trans-unit.target: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (an XML process definition language).

trans-unit.source: The default workflow file name is *workflow.xml*.
trans-unit.target: The default workflow file name is *workflow.xml*.

trans-unit.source: You will save the workflow file locally, and then deploy it to the HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will save the workflow file locally, and then deploy it to the HDInsight cluster by using Azure PowerShell later in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The Hive action in the workflow calls a HiveQL script file.
trans-unit.target: The Hive action in the workflow calls a HiveQL script file.

trans-unit.source: This script file contains three HiveQL statements:
trans-unit.target: This script file contains three HiveQL statements:

trans-unit.source: **The DROP TABLE statement** deletes the log4j Hive table if it exists.
trans-unit.target: **The DROP TABLE statement** deletes the log4j Hive table if it exists.

trans-unit.source: **The CREATE TABLE statement** creates a log4j Hive external table, which points to the location of the log4j log file;
trans-unit.target: **The CREATE TABLE statement** creates a log4j Hive external table, which points to the location of the log4j log file;

trans-unit.source: **The location of the log4j log file**.
trans-unit.target: **The location of the log4j log file**.

trans-unit.source: The field delimiter is ",".
trans-unit.target: The field delimiter is ",".

trans-unit.source: The default line delimiter is "\n".
trans-unit.target: The default line delimiter is "\n".

trans-unit.source: A Hive external table is used to avoid the data file being removed from the original location, in case you want to run the Oozie workflow multiple times.
trans-unit.target: A Hive external table is used to avoid the data file being removed from the original location, in case you want to run the Oozie workflow multiple times.

trans-unit.source: **The INSERT OVERWRITE statement** counts the occurrences of each log-level type from the log4j Hive table, and it saves the output to an Azure Blob storage location.
trans-unit.target: **The INSERT OVERWRITE statement** counts the occurrences of each log-level type from the log4j Hive table, and it saves the output to an Azure Blob storage location.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: There is a known Hive path issue.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: There is a known Hive path issue.

trans-unit.source: You will run into this problem when submitting an Oozie job.
trans-unit.target: You will run into this problem when submitting an Oozie job.

trans-unit.source: The instructions for fixing the issue can be found on the TechNet Wiki: [HDInsight Hive error: Unable to rename][technetwiki-hive-error].
trans-unit.target: The instructions for fixing the issue can be found on the TechNet Wiki: [HDInsight Hive error: Unable to rename][technetwiki-hive-error].

trans-unit.source: **To define the HiveQL script file to be called by the workflow**
trans-unit.target: **To define the HiveQL script file to be called by the workflow**

trans-unit.source: Create a text file with the following content:
trans-unit.target: Create a text file with the following content:

trans-unit.source: There are three variables used in the script:
trans-unit.target: There are three variables used in the script:

trans-unit.source: ${hiveTableName}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveTableName}

trans-unit.source: ${hiveDataFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveDataFolder}

trans-unit.source: ${hiveOutputFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveOutputFolder}

trans-unit.source: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) will pass these values to this HiveQL script at run time.
trans-unit.target: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) will pass these values to this HiveQL script at run time.

trans-unit.source: Save the file as **C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\useooziewf.hql** by using ANSI (ASCII) encoding.
trans-unit.target: Save the file as **C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\useooziewf.hql** by using ANSI (ASCII) encoding.

trans-unit.source: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.) This script file will be deployed to the HDInsight cluster later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.) This script file will be deployed to the HDInsight cluster later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: **To define a workflow**
trans-unit.target: **To define a workflow**

trans-unit.source: Create a text file with the following content:
trans-unit.target: Create a text file with the following content:

trans-unit.source: There are two actions defined in the workflow.
trans-unit.target: There are two actions defined in the workflow.

trans-unit.source: The start-to action is *RunHiveScript*.
trans-unit.target: The start-to action is *RunHiveScript*.

trans-unit.source: If the action runs *OK*, the next action is *RunSqoopExport*.
trans-unit.target: If the action runs *OK*, the next action is *RunSqoopExport*.

trans-unit.source: The RunHiveScript has several variables.
trans-unit.target: The RunHiveScript has several variables.

trans-unit.source: You will pass the values when you submit the Oozie job from your workstation by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You will pass the values when you submit the Oozie job from your workstation by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source:
Workflow variablesDescription
${jobTracker}Specify the URL of the Hadoop job tracker.
trans-unit.target:
Workflow variablesDescription
${jobTracker}Specify the URL of the Hadoop job tracker.

trans-unit.source: Use jobtrackerhost:9010 on HDInsight cluster version 3.0 and 2.0. ${nameNode}Specify the URL of the Hadoop name node.
trans-unit.target: Use jobtrackerhost:9010 on HDInsight cluster version 3.0 and 2.0. ${nameNode}Specify the URL of the Hadoop name node.

trans-unit.source: Use the default file system wasb:// address, for example, wasb://<containerName>@<storageAccountName>.blob.core.windows.net. ${queueName}Specifies the queue name that the job will be submitted to.
trans-unit.target: Use the default file system wasb:// address, for example, wasb://<containerName>@<storageAccountName>.blob.core.windows.net. ${queueName}Specifies the queue name that the job will be submitted to.

trans-unit.source: Use default.
trans-unit.target: Use default.

trans-unit.source: Save the file as **C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\workflow.xml** by using ANSI (ASCII) encoding.
trans-unit.target: Save the file as **C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\workflow.xml** by using ANSI (ASCII) encoding.

trans-unit.source: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)
trans-unit.target: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)

trans-unit.source: **To define coordinator**
trans-unit.target: **To define coordinator**

trans-unit.source: Create a text file with the following content:
trans-unit.target: Create a text file with the following content:

trans-unit.source: There are five variables used in the definition file:
trans-unit.target: There are five variables used in the definition file:

trans-unit.source: Variable
trans-unit.target: Variable

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ${coordFrequency}
trans-unit.target: ${coordFrequency}

trans-unit.source: Job pause time.
trans-unit.target: Job pause time.

trans-unit.source: Frequency is always expressed in minutes.
trans-unit.target: Frequency is always expressed in minutes.

trans-unit.source: ${coordStart}
trans-unit.target: ${coordStart}

trans-unit.source: Job start time.
trans-unit.target: Job start time.

trans-unit.source: ${coordEnd}
trans-unit.target: ${coordEnd}

trans-unit.source: Job end time.
trans-unit.target: Job end time.

trans-unit.source: ${coordTimezone}
trans-unit.target: ${coordTimezone}

trans-unit.source: Oozie processes coordinator jobs in a fixed time zone with no daylight saving time (typically represented by using UTC).
trans-unit.target: Oozie processes coordinator jobs in a fixed time zone with no daylight saving time (typically represented by using UTC).

trans-unit.source: This time zone is referred as the "Oozie processing timezone."
trans-unit.target: This time zone is referred as the "Oozie processing timezone."

trans-unit.source: ${wfPath}
trans-unit.target: ${wfPath}

trans-unit.source: The path for the workflow.xml.
trans-unit.target: The path for the workflow.xml.

trans-unit.source: If the workflow file name is not the default file name (workflow.xml), you must specify it.
trans-unit.target: If the workflow file name is not the default file name (workflow.xml), you must specify it.

trans-unit.source: Save the file as **C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\coordinator.xml** by using the ANSI (ASCII) encoding.
trans-unit.target: Save the file as **C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\coordinator.xml** by using the ANSI (ASCII) encoding.

trans-unit.source: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)
trans-unit.target: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)

trans-unit.source: Deploy the Oozie project and prepare the tutorial
trans-unit.target: Deploy the Oozie project and prepare the tutorial

trans-unit.source: You will run an Azure PowerShell script to perform the following:
trans-unit.target: You will run an Azure PowerShell script to perform the following:

trans-unit.source: Copy the HiveQL script (useoozie.hql) to Azure Blob storage, wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useoozie.hql.
trans-unit.target: Copy the HiveQL script (useoozie.hql) to Azure Blob storage, wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useoozie.hql.

trans-unit.source: Copy workflow.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml.
trans-unit.target: Copy workflow.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml.

trans-unit.source: Copy coordinator.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/coordinator.xml.
trans-unit.target: Copy coordinator.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/coordinator.xml.

trans-unit.source: Copy the data file (/example/data/sample.log) to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/data/sample.log.
trans-unit.target: Copy the data file (/example/data/sample.log) to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/data/sample.log.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure SQL database table for storing Sqoop export data.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure SQL database table for storing Sqoop export data.

trans-unit.source: The table name is *log4jLogCount*.
trans-unit.target: The table name is *log4jLogCount*.

trans-unit.source: **Understand HDInsight storage**
trans-unit.target: **Understand HDInsight storage**

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for data storage.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for data storage.

trans-unit.source: wasb:// is Microsoft's implementation of the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) in Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: wasb:// is Microsoft's implementation of the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) in Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].

trans-unit.source: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, an Azure Blob storage account and a specific container from that account is designated as the default file system, like in HDFS.
trans-unit.target: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, an Azure Blob storage account and a specific container from that account is designated as the default file system, like in HDFS.

trans-unit.source: In addition to this storage account, you can add additional storage accounts from the same Azure subscription or from different Azure subscriptions during the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: In addition to this storage account, you can add additional storage accounts from the same Azure subscription or from different Azure subscriptions during the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about adding additional storage accounts, see [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].
trans-unit.target: For instructions about adding additional storage accounts, see [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].

trans-unit.source: To simplify the Azure PowerShell script used in this tutorial, all of the files are stored in the default file system container located at */tutorials/useoozie*.
trans-unit.target: To simplify the Azure PowerShell script used in this tutorial, all of the files are stored in the default file system container located at */tutorials/useoozie*.

trans-unit.source: By default, this container has the same name as the HDInsight cluster name.
trans-unit.target: By default, this container has the same name as the HDInsight cluster name.

trans-unit.source: The syntax is:
trans-unit.target: The syntax is:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Only the *wasb://* syntax is supported in HDInsight cluster version 3.0.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Only the *wasb://* syntax is supported in HDInsight cluster version 3.0.

trans-unit.source: The older *asv://* syntax is supported in HDInsight 2.1 and 1.6 clusters, but it is not supported in HDInsight 3.0 clusters.
trans-unit.target: The older *asv://* syntax is supported in HDInsight 2.1 and 1.6 clusters, but it is not supported in HDInsight 3.0 clusters.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The wasb:// path is a virtual path.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The wasb:// path is a virtual path.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].

trans-unit.source: A file that is stored in the default file system container can be accessed from HDInsight by using any of the following URIs (I am using workflow.xml as an example):
trans-unit.target: A file that is stored in the default file system container can be accessed from HDInsight by using any of the following URIs (I am using workflow.xml as an example):

trans-unit.source: If you want to access the file directly from the storage account, the blob name for the file is:
trans-unit.target: If you want to access the file directly from the storage account, the blob name for the file is:

trans-unit.source: **Understand Hive internal and external tables**
trans-unit.target: **Understand Hive internal and external tables**

trans-unit.source: There are a few things you need to know about Hive internal and external tables:
trans-unit.target: There are a few things you need to know about Hive internal and external tables:

trans-unit.source: The CREATE TABLE command creates an internal table, also known as a managed table.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE TABLE command creates an internal table, also known as a managed table.

trans-unit.source: The data file must be located in the default container.
trans-unit.target: The data file must be located in the default container.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE TABLE command moves the data file to the /hive/warehouse/<TableName> folder in the default container.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE TABLE command moves the data file to the /hive/warehouse/<TableName> folder in the default container.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command creates an external table.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command creates an external table.

trans-unit.source: The data file can be located outside the default container.
trans-unit.target: The data file can be located outside the default container.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command does not move the data file.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command does not move the data file.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command doesn't allow any subfolders under the folder that is specified in the LOCATION clause.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command doesn't allow any subfolders under the folder that is specified in the LOCATION clause.

trans-unit.source: This is the reason why the tutorial makes a copy of the sample.log file.
trans-unit.target: This is the reason why the tutorial makes a copy of the sample.log file.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [HDInsight: Hive Internal and External Tables Intro][cindygross-hive-tables].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [HDInsight: Hive Internal and External Tables Intro][cindygross-hive-tables].

trans-unit.source: **To prepare the tutorial**
trans-unit.target: **To prepare the tutorial**

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows PowerShell ISE (in the Windows 8 Start screen, type **PowerShell_ISE**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows PowerShell ISE (in the Windows 8 Start screen, type **PowerShell_ISE**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Start Windows PowerShell on Windows 8 and Windows][powershell-start]).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Start Windows PowerShell on Windows 8 and Windows][powershell-start]).

trans-unit.source: In the bottom pane, run the following command to connect to your Azure subscription:
trans-unit.target: In the bottom pane, run the following command to connect to your Azure subscription:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.

trans-unit.source: This method of adding a subscription connection times out, and after 12 hours, you will have to run the cmdlet again.
trans-unit.target: This method of adding a subscription connection times out, and after 12 hours, you will have to run the cmdlet again.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have multiple Azure subscriptions and the default subscription is not the one you want to use, use the Select-AzureSubscription cmdlet to select a subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have multiple Azure subscriptions and the default subscription is not the one you want to use, use the Select-AzureSubscription cmdlet to select a subscription.

trans-unit.source: For more descriptions of the variables, see the [Prerequisites](#prerequisites) section in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For more descriptions of the variables, see the [Prerequisites](#prerequisites) section in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Run the Oozie project
trans-unit.target: Run the Oozie project

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell currently doesn't provide any cmdlets for defining Oozie jobs.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell currently doesn't provide any cmdlets for defining Oozie jobs.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Invoke-RestMethod** cmdlet to invoke Oozie web services.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Invoke-RestMethod** cmdlet to invoke Oozie web services.

trans-unit.source: The Oozie web services API is a HTTP REST JSON API.
trans-unit.target: The Oozie web services API is a HTTP REST JSON API.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Oozie web services API, see [Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation][apache-oozie-400] (for HDInsight cluster version 3.0) or [Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation][apache-oozie-332] (for HDInsight cluster version 2.1).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Oozie web services API, see [Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation][apache-oozie-400] (for HDInsight cluster version 3.0) or [Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation][apache-oozie-332] (for HDInsight cluster version 2.1).

trans-unit.source: **To submit an Oozie job**
trans-unit.target: **To submit an Oozie job**

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows PowerShell ISE (in Windows 8 Start screen, type **PowerShell_ISE**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows PowerShell ISE (in Windows 8 Start screen, type **PowerShell_ISE**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Start Windows PowerShell on Windows 8 and Windows][powershell-start]).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Start Windows PowerShell on Windows 8 and Windows][powershell-start]).

trans-unit.source: Copy the following script into the script pane, and then set the first fourteen variables (however, skip **$storageUri**).
trans-unit.target: Copy the following script into the script pane, and then set the first fourteen variables (however, skip **$storageUri**).

trans-unit.source: For more descriptions of the variables, see the [Prerequisites](#prerequisites) section in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For more descriptions of the variables, see the [Prerequisites](#prerequisites) section in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: $coordstart and $coordend are the workflow starting and ending time.
trans-unit.target: $coordstart and $coordend are the workflow starting and ending time.

trans-unit.source: To find out the UTC/GMT time, search "utc time" on bing.com.
trans-unit.target: To find out the UTC/GMT time, search "utc time" on bing.com.

trans-unit.source: The $coordFrequency is how often in minutes you want to run the workflow.
trans-unit.target: The $coordFrequency is how often in minutes you want to run the workflow.

trans-unit.source: Append the following to the script.
trans-unit.target: Append the following to the script.

trans-unit.source: This part defines the Oozie payload:
trans-unit.target: This part defines the Oozie payload:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The major difference compared to the workflow submission payload file is the variable **oozie.coord.application.path**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The major difference compared to the workflow submission payload file is the variable **oozie.coord.application.path**.

trans-unit.source: When you submit a workflow job, you use **oozie.wf.application.path** instead.
trans-unit.target: When you submit a workflow job, you use **oozie.wf.application.path** instead.

trans-unit.source: Append the following to the script.
trans-unit.target: Append the following to the script.

trans-unit.target: This part checks the Oozie web service status:

trans-unit.target: Append the following to the script.

trans-unit.source: This part creates an Oozie job:
trans-unit.target: This part creates an Oozie job:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you submit a workflow job, you must make another web service call to start the job after the job is created.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you submit a workflow job, you must make another web service call to start the job after the job is created.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the coordinator job is triggered by time.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the coordinator job is triggered by time.

trans-unit.source: The job will start automatically.
trans-unit.target: The job will start automatically.

trans-unit.source: Remove the # signs if you want to run the additional functions.
trans-unit.target: Remove the # signs if you want to run the additional functions.

trans-unit.source: If your HDinsight cluster is version 2.1, replace "https://$clusterName.azurehdinsight.net:443/oozie/v2/" with "https://$clusterName.azurehdinsight.net:443/oozie/v1/".
trans-unit.target: If your HDinsight cluster is version 2.1, replace "https://$clusterName.azurehdinsight.net:443/oozie/v2/" with "https://$clusterName.azurehdinsight.net:443/oozie/v1/".

trans-unit.source: HDInsight cluster version 2.1 does not supports version 2 of the web services.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight cluster version 2.1 does not supports version 2 of the web services.

trans-unit.source: Click **Run Script** or press **F5** to run the script.
trans-unit.target: Click **Run Script** or press **F5** to run the script.

trans-unit.target: Connect to your SQL Database to see the exported data.

trans-unit.source: **To check the job error log**
trans-unit.target: **To check the job error log**

trans-unit.source: To troubleshoot a workflow, the Oozie log file can be found at C:\apps\dist\oozie-3.3.2.1.3.2.0-05\oozie-win-distro\logs\Oozie.log from the cluster headnode.
trans-unit.target: To troubleshoot a workflow, the Oozie log file can be found at C:\apps\dist\oozie-3.3.2.1.3.2.0-05\oozie-win-distro\logs\Oozie.log from the cluster headnode.

trans-unit.source: For information on RDP, see [Administering HDInsight clusters using the Azure preview portal][hdinsight-admin-portal].
trans-unit.target: For information on RDP, see [Administering HDInsight clusters using the Azure preview portal][hdinsight-admin-portal].

trans-unit.target: **To rerun the tutorial**

trans-unit.source: To rerun the workflow, you must perform the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: To rerun the workflow, you must perform the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Delete the Hive script output file.
trans-unit.target: Delete the Hive script output file.

trans-unit.source: Delete the data in the log4jLogsCount table.
trans-unit.target: Delete the data in the log4jLogsCount table.
